listing.letting_fees: In addition to the monthly rental, ludlowthompson charge an administration fee (which is variable percentage of the weekly rent, depending on the property To Let) for organising the full move-in process from preparing agreements, undertaking reference checks to follow-ups for verbal verification. If you pay our 500 reservation fee (which is not an extra charge as it is deducted from the first rental account) to reserve a property please note that it is non-refundable with the exception being when the Landlord decides not to proceed with the Tenancy. Acceptance of your reservation fee does not imply a Tenancy which will only be created once all parties have signed the Tenancy agreement. Once your offer has been accepted a further 500 will be taken, and then 5 days afterwards the balance of the full rental due along with six weeks deposit and the first month's rent. As fees are subject to change from time to time, please check with your local office for up to date costs relating to renting a property.
listing.description: Unique house in a corner plot with a large front drive/patio offered chain free. This double fronted house was a much loved family home for decades and will be again after some tlc, there is even scope to convert the loft (stpp). The house has the perfect ratio of living space and bedrooms, comprising: Two receptions rooms, kitchen that leads to the rear garden, utility room, four large double bedrooms, two bathrooms, and a cellar. The large front patio allows for off street parking, a rarity in this area. Finally, the period features have been kept, with a number of fireplaces, sash windows and cornicing. Ivanhoe Road is a quiet residential street, yet is only a short walk to the boutique shops and trendy cafes/pubs of both Lordship Lane and Bellenden Road. Amazing transport links - around 5 minute walk to East Dulwich station, and 10 minutes to both Denmark Hill and Peckham Rye rail stations! Please call for more information or to book a viewingSecond ReceptionFirst ReceptionMaster BedroomBedroom 2KitchenBathroomBedroom 4GardenBathroom 2

listing.description: A fantastic opportunity to acquire this stunning fully newly refurbished one bedroom apartment. This bright and airy property is located on the ground floor with direct access to a beautiful patio style garden. This property benefits from a complete refurbishment, with brand new wood flooring throughout, a newly fitted high spec kitchen with white gloss units and wooden worktops. It further benefits from a brand new fitted bathroom with luxury natural stone tiles and stainless rain shower over the bath. The property is painted white throughout leaving a blank canvass for its new owners. The reception room has floor to ceiling windows allowing for plenty of natural light, it also boasts of direct access to a rear garden. Centrally located for easy access to a range of local amenities it is also ideally situated moments from Elephant & Castle (Bakerloo & Northern line) Underground and mainline stations. listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or ??420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee ??? From ??440 (Inc. VAT)???

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent ??? To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance ??? 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit ??? Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds ??125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - ??420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of ??54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - ??75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - ??90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - ??150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - ??30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

??? Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.

listing.description: A lovely, four bedroom, mid-century townhouse with a fabulous layout in a secluded location. There is ample open-plan living space on the ground floor with a contemporary, high spec kitchen leading down onto a fabulous large reception room which has a conservatory to the rear with doors to the pretty, south-west facing garden. There is a garage to the front of the property and the master bedroom has doors onto a balcony overlooking the garden.SituationRockwell Gardens is a delightful private road, on the Dulwich Estate, off Dulwich Wood Park. It is within easy reach of Gipsy Hill station which is only half a mile away and has trains to London Bridge and Victoria as well as the London Overground to Shoreditch, Canada Water and Clapham Jct. Sydenham Hill station is also half a mile away with trains to Victoria. Kingswood Primary School and Kingsdale Secondary School are within half a mile. The Dulwich independent schools are also within easy reach. Crystal Palace triangle is within a mile and there are local shops, bars and restaurants on Gipsy Rd which is 0.2 miles away.
listing.short_description: A lovely, four bedroom, mid-century townhouse

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or ??420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee ??? From ??440 (Inc. VAT)???

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent ??? To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance ??? 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit ??? Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds ??125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - ??420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of ??54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - ??75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - ??90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - ??150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - ??30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

listing.description: A lovely, Victorian, terraced family home in the heart of East Dulwich. The house has been extended to provide five good size bedrooms as well as two bath/shower rooms. There is a kitchen/breakfast room at the rear and the double reception room has been opened up at the back to provide spacious reception space.SituationZenoria St is just off Lordship Lane, conveniently situated for the shops, bars and restaurants as well as East Dulwich station which is only 0.3 miles away and provides connections to London Bridge. Denmark Hill is also easily accessible (1 mile away) by foot or bus with connections to London Victoria as well as the Thameslink line to Blackfriars and Kings Cross.

listing.description: A stunning detached house set within over a third of an acre in Dulwich Village. The house has been extended and renovated to an excellent standard to create fabulous lateral space. There is a spacious, double-height entrance hall leading to the extensive living space and through to the gorgeous south-facing garden that extends to almost 150 x 72 ft and includes a beautiful, large limestone terrace. There is study to the rear which has its own entrance from the garden. The house is set back from the road by a pretty front lawn and a drive which leads to the garage and off-street parking for several cars.SituationVillage Way is on the west side of Dulwich Village so within very easy reach of Herne Hill station (with trains to London Victoria and Blackfriars) as well as North Dulwich station which as trains to London Bridge. Dulwich Village is moments away with lovely cafes and restaurants as well as the Picture Gallery and Dulwich Park. Alleyns, jags and jpas are all within walking distance and Dulwich College and Dulwich Prep are also within extremely easy reach.
listing.short_description: A stunning detached house set within a third of an acre in Dulwich Village.

listing.description: An excellent top floor two bedroom apartment with far reaching views and 815 square foot of internal accommodation. Daphne Court is a well managed purpose built block with a Share of Freehold and 947 year lease close to the heart of Ealing Broadway. The front facing reception room is an impressive 21ft in length and lends itself to having a defined sitting and dining area. The master bedroom is 13ft with a range of fitted wardrobes and there is a good size second bedroom overlooking the rear also with fitted wardrobes. There is a family size bathroom servicing the two bedrooms in addition to a separate WC. The separate 11ft kitchen overlooks the rear and comes with a range of fitted cupboards with space for freestanding appliances.SituationDaphne Court is located on Castlebar Road which is only 0.3 miles to centre of Ealing Broadway and Ealing Broadway station. The station has two London Underground lines, District and Central which both go through the heart of central London. The overground service goes out to Heathrow, Reading and Oxford in one direction and London Paddington station in the other. The Elizabeth Line which is part of the pending Crossrail network (due May 2018) will further enhance the overground service with more stations added beyond Paddington as far out as Canary Wharf with significantly reduced journey times. Several prestigious schools are within close proximity which include, Harvington, Durston, St Benedict's, Montpelier, St Augustine's and Notting Hill & Ealing High.OutsideBalcony; Accessed via double door from the reception room. Front facing private balcony / terrace. South westerly facing.Communal Gardens; Landscaped communal gardens area to front and rear of the building.Garage; 17'2" x 8'4". Good size garage in a block which is accessed via the driveway to the side of the building.
listing.short_description: An excellent top floor two bedroom apartment with far reaching views and 815 square foot of internal accommodation. Daphne Court is a well managed purpose built block with a Share of Freehold and 947 year lease close to the heart of Ealing Broadway. Lift, secure entry system and garage.
listing.displayable_address: Daphne Court, Castlebar Road, Ealing W5

listing.description: This excellent two bedroom sub-penthouse apartment is located in the popular Boardwalk Place. The property benefits from a large reception room, which leads on to a 2nd dining/reception room that overlooks the exceptional roof terrace. The property comes with private secure parking space.Boardwalk Place is one of the closest developments to the Canary Wharf Estate and just a short walk to the many shops, restaurants and bars on offer in Canary Wharf ??? it also provides access to both the Jubilee Line, DLR and upcoming Crossrail. Local transport: Canary Wharf (Jubilee Line) and Blackwall (DLR) stations. Additionally, Crossrail/Elizabeth Line from 2018.

listing.description: Stunning four bed, two bath 1930's semi located along a sought after residential road within easy reach of Oxleas Woods. This superb property has been much improved by the current vendor and offers spacious family living. Which comprises of lounge, modern fitted kitchen/diner, three well proportioned bedrooms and contemporary family bathroom. To the top floor is a large master/fourth bedroom with stunning rooftop views over London with a en suite bathroom walk in wardrobe with office space. This fantastic property also boasts many features which include double glazing, gas central heating, garage/workshop, drive and landscaped rear garden.

listing.description: If you would like to spread your wings over nearly 4,000 square feet of fantastic lateral space, while taking in far reaching views of landmark sites, such as the london eye, the shard, the gherkin, canary wharf and the brompton oratory, to name but A few, while looking down on to the lush grass of prince's gardens, abundant with mature trees, or the wide, bustling walk-way up exhibition road towards hyde park, then here it is.A passenger lift carries you up to the 8th floor of this iconic art-deco building built in 1953 where, from the landing the doors open to reveal two apartments that merge in to one, with five potential bedrooms, bathrooms, a steam room and cloakrooms. The extensive entertaining space incorporates two drawing rooms, dining areas, a games room, a study and two kitchens, to arrange as you wish to suit one's own requirements. There is air-conditioning throughout the entertaining space and in various bedrooms. There are two parking spaces available in the basement of the building along with a storage cupboard.

The 18???3 reception room spans the front of the house and has a Southerly aspect so great amounts of light beams in during the day, the bathroom is spacious and has an air of decadence with a large free standing bath and for those with frequent visitors or wanting a flatmate both bedrooms are good doubles and almost equal in size. The split level decked garden offers great outdoor entertaining space and with the Spring and Summer ahead will be sure to appeal to the bbq enthusiasts. The property is almost equidistant from both Clapham South and Balham stations (0.5m and 0.4m) and the huge array of bars, shops and restaurants are on your doorstep for both Clapham South and Balham.

The power generated from the panels attracts around ??200 in income per quarter by sending energy back to the grid.As you enter this happy home you get an instant feel of comfort. On the ground floor you have the spacious living room which is light and bright with its feature fireplace. The main reception room leads onto the second reception room which has direct access to the garden and is used as an office by the current owners. The kitchen looks out onto the plush garden and has modern fitted units as well as a breakfast bar which seamlessly divides it from the breakfast/dining room. Downstairs also hosts a utility area as well as a modern shower room & toilet.Upstairs hosts the three bedrooms. The master bedroom is a large double and has fitted bedroom furniture providing ample storage space. The second bedroom also a double bedroom also has fitted furniture and is bright and airy with two windows. The third bedroom is a large than average single room but has smart storage with a fitted wardrobe and overhead cupboards. The upstairs family bathroom is spacious, highlighted by its four piece suite with a shower, bath, basin and toilet.The property is oozing with potential with the ability to add a first floor extension subject to planning. You also have a fantastic garden which a paved area for those summer barbeques and also hosts a through shed and green house as well as a pond. You have side access into the gardenLocation wise the property is on a quiet cul-de-sac neighbouring the leafy Whitehall Recreation ground, conveniently located for the local shops in Chatterton Village. Both Bromley South and Bickley Stations are within easy reach offering fast and frequent commuter services to Victoria with both Thameslink & Southeastern rail connections available. Local schools include Bishop Justice (rated as good by ofsted), Ravenswood boys (rated as good by ofsted) whilst Hayes (rated as outstanding by ofsted) and Ravensbourne (rated as good by ofsted) are also close by.Request a viewing instantly to experience this lovely home for yourself
